title: BBC Local Live: Essex on Thursday, 25 February 2016 - BBC News
summary: three care workers who admitted assaulting an elderly resident at the old deanery home are jailed .
essex county council is criticised for how it has handled changes to its school transport policy .
former southend player adrian clarke says blues boss phil brown should think `` very carefully '' about any potential offer of a return to bolton wanderers .
man jailed for owning world war two gun relieved to be out of prison .
more news , sport , travel and weather updates from 08:00 on friday .

text: that 's it from us at essex live for today - thanks for joining us .
we 'll resume with updates for the county from 08:00 tomorrow .
have a great evening .

documents.title: essex police leadership praised in latest hmic report
text: essex police has been praised for its leadership in the latest report by government inspectors .
hm inspectorate of constabulary ( hmic ) said the force understood what was expected of its leaders at every level , and the chief constable was seen by staff as having a `` positive impact '' .
however , the inspectors pointed out that information about the future direction of essex police could be better explained at some levels .

documents.title: police car crashes with van in chelmsford
text: earlier we told you waterhouse lane in chelmsford was closed because of a crash at the writtle road junction .
essex police says the collision involved a police car and a white van .
no-one was injured but a metal pedestrian barrier was damaged .
the road has since reopened .

documents.title: men who smuggled cannabis alongside frozen chicken have sentence appeal rejected
text: two essex pensioners caught when the stench of rotting poultry led police to a huge cannabis stash in laindon have been told their jail terms are well-deserved , despite their age .

ex-police officer michael alexander kinkaid , 72 , and former meat trader antony raymond wright , 77 , were each sentenced to seven years in jail at basildon crown court in december , for smuggling the drug alongside frozen chickens .
lawyers for the duo argued at london 's appeal court that their jail terms were too tough , given their advanced age and lack of previous convictions .
but the bid to get their sentences reduced was refused .

documents.title: police stopped 55 essex motorists 'doing over 100mph ' in 2014-15
text: more than 50 motorists in essex were caught by police speeding at more than 100mph in the past year .
the highest speed recorded in the county was 130mph - almost twice the national limit - on the a120 .
the figures came from a freedom of information request from 42 of the uk 's 45 police forces .
the fastest clocked was a cambridgeshire motorist caught travelling at 156mph .

documents.title: women 's cricket super league finals day to be held in chelmsford
text: the first women 's cricket super league finals day will be held in chelmsford this summer , it has been announced .
the event will take place at the county ground on 21 august .
earlier today the team names and schedule were revealed .
you can read all about the tournament here .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: elderly resident left in the hands of 'evil and ruthless ' care workers
text: the daughter of 84-year-old florence joan maddison , who was abused at the old deanery care home , told chelmsford crown court her mother had been left defenceless at the hands of her abusers because of her disabilities .
`` these so-called carers were evil and ruthless and totally lacking in any standard of compassion for an elderly lady , '' gillian lee said .
`` time and time again , she was saying 'stop you 're hurting me ' .
they took no notice of her pain and distress . ''
three care workers were jailed for four months for the abuse this afternoon .

documents.title: investigated old deanery after concerns from a whistleblower
text: the bbc 's panorama sent a reporter to work at the old deanery care home near braintree after being approached by a whistleblower in 2013 .
each of the three women jailed for four months today was filmed assaulting and abusing 84-year-old florence joan maddison , who was a resident at the home .

documents.title: old deanery sentencing : judge describes abuse as 'massive breach of trust '
text: sentencing each of the women at chelmsford crown court , judge patricia lynch described the abuse as a `` massive breach of trust '' .
`` you are a disgrace .
you deserve to be punished , '' judge lynch told the defendants .
`` we are dealing with an 84-year-old lady who was vulnerable physically and vulnerable mentally and she could not help the way that she behaved because of her condition . ''

documents.title: braintree care home workers jailed for assaulting elderly resident
text: three women who admitted assaulting an elderly resident following an investigation by the bbc 's panorama programme have been jailed for four months .
anita ray ( left ) , 45 , lorna clark ( right ) , 46 , and adeshola adediwura , 33 , all admitted one charge of assault at chelmsford crown court .

the trio were secretly filmed at the old deanery home two years ago abusing former social worker and volunteer florence joan maddison , 84 , who had dementia , cancer , diabetes and was partially paralysed .

documents.title: breakingthree care workers jailed for old deanery care home abuse
text: three care workers have been jailed for assaulting and harassing elderly people at a care home in braintree .
more details to follow .

documents.title: baby arrival could rule noel hunt out of southend match
text: southend united striker noel hunt could miss tomorrow 's league one trip to port vale - as his partner is due to give birth .
phil brown says he could be forced to leave the 33-year-old out of the squad as the blues take the 195-mile trip up north .
southend are currently seventh in the league table - just one position off the play-off places .

documents.title: lower thames crossing : 1,000 people expected to attended meeting
text: about 1,000 people are expected to attend a meeting tonight about proposals for a new link across the thames , between essex and kent .
some local residents are angry about the plans , but highways england says no decision has been made on where the crossing will be built .
the meeting starts at 18:30 at the tilbury cruise terminal and is hosted by bbc essex 's james whale .
the consultation closes on 24 march .

documents.title: man found guilty of attacking ambulance driver in road-rage incident
text: a man who forced an ambulance to stop before punching the driver in a road-rage attack in 2014 has been banned from driving .
michael kearns , 46 , of broomfield , cut up the vehicle , which was transporting an elderly patient to hospital , in chelmsford before stopping to attack the paramedic .

kearns , who had pleaded not guilty to dangerous driving and assault , was banned from driving for a year and has been ordered to complete unpaid work for the community after a trial at chelmsford crown court .

documents.title: man in serious condition after drilling through power cable
text: a man has been flown to hospital with serious burns after an accident in loughton .
local news site everything epping forest first reported that emergency crews had been called to spareleaze hill .
it is believed somebody had drilled through a power cable .
a man in his mid-20s has been taken to the burns unit at broomfiled hospital with injuries that are thought to be serious but not life-threatening .

documents.title: mother angry over essex county council 's handling of school transport
text: an essex mum says she 's angry over the way essex county council handled changes to its free school transport policy .
the authority now only offers subsidised transport to a child 's nearest secondary school , something the local government ombudsmen found was n't made clear to parents .
kate crabb said she was n't told she would have to pay for her child to get to school until after the school place had been accepted - something she says is `` wrong '' .

documents.title: thieves steal five-figure sum in early morning shop raid
text: thieves have stolen a five-figure sum of money from a shop in brentwood , police say .
a shop assistant was threatened and punched when two men entered mccolls in ongar road at about 05:30 this morning .
both suspects were white and wore balaclavas and orange cotton gloves .
you can read a full description on the essex police facebook page .

documents.title: leigh-on-sea man onboard the flying scotsman
text: flying scotsman is making the journey from london king 's cross to its new home in york , and onboard is a former driver of the legendary locomotive .
ron kennedy , 83 , from leigh-on-sea , drove the scotsman from 1956 until he retired seven years later .
he said he was impressed with the £ 4.2m restoration .
`` it 's unbelievable , '' he said .
`` i never dreamt about being on it again .
to be out with it is just fantastic . ''
the locomotive is making the journey so it can go on display at the national railway museum .

documents.title: nine-year-old boy wins bravery award for saving life of suicidal man
text: a scout has won an award for saving a young man 's life after talking him down from a ledge at grays beach .
author: Thurrock Gazette

documents.title: man jailed for owning world war two gun is freed
text: a braintree businessman who was jailed after police found his dad 's world war two service revolver in his house says he 's glad he 's now free .
john benson , 55 , was sentenced to two years in prison after he admitted owning a prohibited.38 revolver and ammunition in november , but was released earlier this week after an appeal .
speaking on bbc essex , mr benson said : `` the judge said 'i 'm going to give you two years ' , then i was sent down .
it was a bit of a shock . ''

documents.title: phil brown should 'think very carefully over any offer from bolton '
text: former southend united player adrian clarke says manager phil brown should think very carefully about any potential offer of a return to bolton wanderers .
brown is being linked with the championship strugglers after they were bought by a consortium led by dean holdsworth .
clarke told bbc essex : `` if i was him i would try and get [ southend ] promoted , then he might get better offers than the one he might be getting from bolton . ''
author: Ben Fryer
BBC Essex Sport

documents.title: man in life-threatening condition after brentwood crash
text: a man remains in a life-threatening condition after a crash between two vehicles near the a127 yesterday morning .
essex police says a 36-year-old man had to be cut from his car after it collided with a truck in warley street in great warley at about 06:50 .
the car driver suffered multiple injuries and was taken by air ambulance to the royal london hospital .
the force is now appealing for any witnesses to come forward .

documents.title: v festival tickets available for essex residents this morning
text: essex residents hoping to catch a glimpse of justin bieber or rihanna at this summer 's v festival can get early access to tickets this morning .
from 09:30 those who live within three miles of hylands park can get tickets , then from 10:30 everybody in the county is able to get their hands on passes before the general sale tomorrow .
if you 're looking for something a little more nostalgic - all saints , soul ii soul and travis will also be performing at the event in august .
more information can be found here .

documents.title: essex county council criticised over school transport policy
text: essex county council has been criticised for how it has handled changes to its school transport policy .
the authority provides subsidised school bus transport for secondary school children only to their nearest school , not to any in their catchment area .
however , the local government ombudsmen found information given did not explain sufficiently how parents find their closest school .
essex county council is now changing the information for this year 's school admissions .
